articles.description: When Southern California theme parks such as Disneyland, Universal Studios and Magic Mountain reopen as early as April, they will likely have to take steps to ensure that screaming on rides doesn't lead to the spread of COVID-19.
articles.content:
Note: A previous version of this story indicated that theme parks may be required to ask visitors not to scream on rides. The state of California has not released any such protocols.

articles.author: Robin Pogrebin, Zachary Small
articles.title: Selling Art to Pay the Bills Divides the Nation’s Museum Directors - The New York Times
articles.description: Bitter debate has ensued as museum leaders around the country discuss whether to permanently embrace a pandemic-spurred policy that allows the sale of art to cover some operating costs.
